toc_entry.title: Feasting On the Oil Glut
toc_entry.description: So you think that OPEC controls the price of oil and that the glut is hurting everybody in the oil business? Wrong. Traders on the international spot market are pulling the strings and getting rich in the process.

toc_entry.title: Draw the Cowboy
toc_entry.description: Twenty top artists test their talent.

toc_entry.title: Coppini the Great
toc_entry.description: Pompeo Coppini’s heroic sculptures and European air were just what Texas fledgling gentry was hungry for in 1901. Since then his name has faded from memory, but his works endure.

toc_entry.title: Hey, This Stuff Ain’t Half Bad
toc_entry.description: Just the thing to go with barbecue or chicken-fried steak-a good bottle of Texas red. Wine, that is.

toc_entry.title: The Rich Girl
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: From lacquered debutante to fossilized ol’ gal, her greatest virtue is endurance.

toc_entry.title: Dust To Dust
toc_entry.description: The cattle are dying, the grass is gone, the ranchers are selling their land. The center of Texas is in a drought that may be the worst in a hundred years.

toc_entry.title: The Politics Of Armageddon
toc_entry.description: W. A. Criswell has spent forty years convincing his huge flock at Dallas’ First Baptist Church that the end of the world is near. He hopes you’ll believe it too.

toc_entry.title: Riding the Range
toc_entry.subtitle: Western Art
toc_entry.description: An interpretation of a classic genre.

toc_entry.title: Fathers And Other Strangers
toc_entry.subtitle: Fatherhood
toc_entry.description: Every son sees his father as his greatest competitor—until the day he becomes a father himself.

toc_entry.title: Dead Oaks
toc_entry.subtitle: Environment
toc_entry.description: Texas’ beloved live oaks are falling victim to a creeping fungus, and no one knows how to stop it.

toc_entry.title: Is All THIs News Fit To Print?
toc_entry.subtitle: Media
toc_entry.description: Inspired by last summer’s media mania in Dallas, our expert offers a few suggestions for spicing up future nonevents.

toc_entry.title: Half Of Me
toc_entry.subtitle: Movies
toc_entry.description: Steve Martin’s new comedy. All of Me, is half-baked; The Gods Must Be Crazy is an amiable tall tale with giraffes; Tanya Roberts is sexy-heroic as Sheena, queen of the pulp jungle drama; Last Night at the alamo is a rowdy last stand.

toc_entry.title: Brahms the Bountiful
toc_entry.subtitle: Classical Music
toc_entry.description: A flood of new Brahms recordings that honor the composer’s 150th birthday reveals an oeuvre of surprising richness.

toc_entry.title: Terminal Education
toc_entry.subtitle: Software
toc_entry.description: Most educational software relies on the same old rote drills and other negative techniques —only now kids get nuked for missing a math problem.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective statewide guide to entertainment and events.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: Winners and losers from the Republican convention; a crash course for butlers; biting the bullet in Orange County; the peculiar appeal of the Texas State Guard; a bookie tells his trade secrets.

toc_entry.title: Touts
toc_entry.description: Hunting gear that even Natty Bumppo would approve of.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Bullock brings a touch of Las Vegas to Texas; two Texas congressmen covet the same plum; an oil company sends a signal to Wall Street; a court fight could cost UT and A&M $20 million; a big man belongs in Houston.
